text: Sebastopolis (), also known as Saleia, was a town of ancient Caria, inhabited during Hellenistic, Roman, and Byzantine times. It minted coins in antiquity. Its site is located near Kızılca in Asiatic Turkey. ==References== Category:Populated places in ancient Caria Category:Former populated places in Turkey Category:Roman towns and cities in Turkey Category:Populated places of the Byzantine Empire Category:History of Denizli Province Category:Tavas District
title: Sebastopolis (Caria)
